question: 3 (b)
sols_html:
Given: A is a real symmetric matrix.

Assuming: The eigenvalue of A closest to 2 is not repeated.

-> The eigenvalues of \((A-sI)^{-1}\) are \((\lambda-s)^{-1}\).

-> The eigenvectors of \((A-sI)^{-1}\) are the eigenvectors of \(A\).

1) Take a random vector \(x_0\).

2) Take \(x_{n+1} = (A -2I)^{-1} x_n\)

3) Normalize x

4) If \(x_n\) is not close enough to \(x_{n-1}\) (ignoring sign flips), go to 2) (â€œclose enoughâ€ being REALLY close)

-> x is now an approximation of the eigenvector of the eigenvalue closest to 2

5)\(\lambda = \langle x,Ax \rangle\) (x was normalized earlier).
